title: Former President Truman and Adlai Stevenson at Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left), wearing a big "Yes for the Charter" button, visits with Adlai Stevenson at the Harry S. Truman Library.  The charter button evidently refers to a vote on a charter for the city of Independence. (Similar to 59-681-1).  From:  Adlai Stevenson

title: Former President Truman and Samuel Solins in Welch, West Virginia
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with Samuel Solins, Attorney, in Welch, West Virginia.  The event is unknown.    From:  Samuel Solins.

title: Former President Truman with officers of the French Line, "Cie Gle Transatlantique"
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman chats with officers of the French Line "Cie Gle Transatlantique," a fleet of ocean liners.  Left to right are:  Sitting - Charles J. Hogan, Publicity Manager; former President Truman; Captain Julien Hannicotte, Operating Manager; Standing - Captain Bernard Leglise, New Operating Manager; Captain Raymond Agnieray, Assistant Operating Manager; Peter J. Rossi, Publicity Department; and Michael Macari, Landing Agent.  The date, location, and event are unknown.  From:  Peter J. Rossi, Publicity Department, the French Line.

title: Truman aboard a boat with officers of The French Line
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman meets with officers of The French Line, "Cie Gle Transatlantique," a fleet of ocean liners, aboard a boat. Left to right are: Stephanie Rancou, photographer; Peter J. Rossi, Publicity Department, French Line; former President Truman; and Charles J. Hogan, Publicity Manager, French Line. From: Peter J. Rossi, Publicity Department, the French Line.

title: Truman with Stanley Woodward and Joseph M. Lunns, Netherlands
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman chats with Joseph M. Lunns (right), Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands, and Stanley Woodward (left), former Chief of Protocol of the White House. The location, date, and event are unknown. From: Peter J. Rossi, Publicity Department, the French Line.

title: Truman, New York Mayor Robert F. Wagner, and New York Governor Harriman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) with New York Governor Averell Harriman (left) and New York Mayor Robert F. Wagner (center), winding up his one-day campaign swing, on behalf of Democratic Presidential nominee Adlai Stevenson and Senatorial candidate Robert F. Wagner, at New York's Manhattan Center.  From:  Maxwell C. Ross, Old American Insurance Company, Kansas City, Missouri

title: Former President Truman and "Santa Claus" (Samuel Rosenman)
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) poses with "Santa Claus," Judge Samuel I. Rosenman, former special counsel to President Truman.  The location is Judge Rosenman's Park Avenue apartment in New York City.  The photo is autographed as follows:  "For President Harry S. Truman with the affectionate regards of Santa Claus, alias Samuel I. Rosenman."

title: Former President Truman preparing to depart from Decatur, Alabama
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with a person off-camera as he prepares to depart from Pryor Field, Decatur, Alabama, after making a major address at a political rally for the Democratic Kennedy-Johnson ticket before a crowd of 10,000 supporters.  From:  J.F. Rowden, Traffic Superintendent, Chemstrand Company, Decatur, Alabama 35602

title: Former President Truman preparing to depart from Decatur, Alabama
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman says goodbye to his admirers at Pryor Field in Decatur, Alabama, where he made a major address at a political rally for the Democratic Kennedy-Johnson ticket before a crowd of 10,000 plus.  From:  J.F. Rowden, Traffic Superintendent, Chemstrand Company, Decatur, Alabama 35602

title: Former President Truman preparing to depart from Decatur, Alabama
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman says farewell to his supporters as he prepares to depart from Pryor Field, Decatur, Alabama, after making a major address before a crowd of 10,000 plus at a political rally for the Democratic Kennedy-Johnson ticket.  From:  J.F. Rowden, Traffic Superintendent, Chemstrand Company, Decatur, Alabama 35602

title: Former President Truman preparing to depart from Decatur, Alabama
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an admirer as he prepares to depart Pryor Field in Decatur, Alabama, where he made a major address at a political rally for the Democratic Kennedy-Johnson ticket before a crowd of 10,000 plus.  A peculiar reflection from the sun caused a shadow across the camera lens making it appear that Mr. Truman is wearing a skull cap.  From:  J.F. Rowden, Traffic Superintendent, Chemstrand Company, Decatur, Alabama

title: Former President Truman holds "Dewey Defeats Truman" newspaper at Pryor Field, Alabama
Scopenote: Prior to departing from Pryor Field, Alabama, former President Harry S. Truman holds up the 1948 newspaper with the headline "Dewey Defeats Truman."  Mr. Truman gave a major address before a crowd of over 10,000 at a political rally for the Kennedy-Johnson Democratic ticket in Decatur, Alabama.  From:  J.F. Rowden, Traffic Superintendent, Chemstrand Company, Decatur, Alabama 35602

title: Former President Truman, Samuel Solins, and others aboard train
Scopenote: Samuel Solins (left) sits next to former President Harry S. Truman (behind Solins)at a luncheon served in a business car of the Norfolk and Western Railway Company.  Others at the table are unidentified.  The former President was in Welch, Virginia, to participate in Veterans' Day activities.  From:  Samuel Solins.

title: Plane at Pryor Field, Alabama, for former President Truman
Scopenote: A small plane waits at Pryor Field for former President Harry S. Truman to board after his visit to Decatur, Alabama, where he made a major address before a crowd of 10,000 plus at a political rally for the Kennedy-Johnson ticket.  From:  J.F. Rowden, Traffic Superintendent, Chemstrand Company, Decatur, Alabama 35602

title: President Harry S. Truman and Others at Whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman converses with Tom Mooney (left), Mayor, Lexington, Kentucky; Senator Virgil Chapman (2nd from right), Democrat, Kentucky; and Tom Underwood (right), editor, Lexington Herald, on the back of a train making a campaign whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky, where the President will address a crowd of supporters.  From:  James F. Rourke.

title: Truman and others at whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky
Scopenote: Senator Virgil Chapman (center), Democrat, Kentucky, points out something of interest to President Harry S. Truman (left) as they view the crowd from the back of a train at a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky, where the President is to make a campaign speech.  Tom Underwood, Editor of The Lexington Leader, is on the right.  From:  James F. Rourke.

title: Truman on train at a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) chats with an unidentified young man on the back of a train making a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky, where the President will address a crowd of supporters.  From:  James F. Rourke.

title: Truman and crowd at whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky
Scopenote: A view of a large crowd of supporters gathered to hear President Harry S. Truman give a campaign speech.  The President can be seen in the distance on the rear platform of a train making a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky.  From:  James F. Rourke.

title: Crowd gathered to hear President Truman speak at Lexington, Kentucky
Scopenote: A crowd of supporters looks toward a train (not visible) where President Harry S. Truman is giving a campaign speech at a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky.  From:  James F. Rourke.

title: Truman speaks to crowd at a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivers a campaign speech from the back of a train to a crowd of supporters gathered to hear him at a whistlestop in Lexington, Missouri.  From:  James F. Rourke.

title: Truman speaks to a crowd at a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky
Scopenote: From the back of a train, President Harry S. Truman delivers a campaign speech to a crowd of people gathered to hear him at a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky.  From:  James F. Rourke.

title: A view of crowd gathered to hear Truman speak in Lexington, Kentucky
Scopenote: A crowd of spectators look toward a train (not visible) where President Harry S. Truman is giving a campaign speech during a whistlestop in Lexington, Kentucky.  From:  James F. Rourke.

title: Truman family aboard the S.S. President  Cleveland in San Francisco
Scopenote: Upon arriving at San Francisco, California, on the S.S. President Cleveland, (seated, left to right) Bess Truman, former President Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman sit on chairs on the aft deck while Mr. Truman is being interviewed by the news media.  The Trumans have just returned from a month's vacation in Hawaii.  (See 2002-463 through 469.) (Original negative included.)  From: Bayard C. Rucker.

title: President Truman with Governor Dewey at dedication of the Idlewild Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, left) shakes hands with New York Governor Thomas E. Dewey (center, right) as they meet for the first time since nominated by their respective parties for the Presidency. They attended the dedication of the Idlewild Airport in New York City, the largest in the world at that time. On the left is Grover A. Whalen, Chairman of the Mayor's Committee for the Commemoration of the Golden Anniversary of the City of New York. Second from the right is New York Mayor William O'Dwyer. The others are unidentified. (See 77-3549 and 3550, 63-976, and 92-8.) From: Bill Sitler, Tulsa, Oklahoma.

title: Truman family and Captain Ehman on board the S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: Standing at the rail on board the S.S. President Cleveland, Mrs. Bess Truman, former President Harry S. Truman, and daughter Margaret, pose for news photographers as they return to San Francisco, California, from a month's vacation in Hawaii.  On Margaret's right is Captain Hobart J. Ehman, skipper of the liner.  (Similar to 2002-463, 464, and 465.) (Original negative included.)  From: Bayard C. Rucker.

title: Bess Truman aboard the S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: Bess Truman poses for a photo aboard the S.S. President Cleveland upon arrival at San Francisco, California, after a month's trip to Hawaii with her husband and daughter.  (See 2002-463 through 469.) (Original negative included.)  From: Bayard C. Rucker.

title: Margaret Truman aboard the S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: Margaret Truman poses for a photo aboard the S.S. President Cleveland upon arrival at San Francisco, California, after a month's trip to Hawaii with her mother and father.  (See 2002-463 through 469.) (Original negative included.)  From: Bayard C. Rucker.

title: Truman family and Captain Ehman leaving the S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: Upon arrival in San Francisco, California, after a month's vacation in Hawaii, former President Harry S. Truman, escorted by Captain Hobart J. Ehman (right), walks down the deck of the liner S.S. President Cleveland in preparation for departure from the ship.  Behind Mr. Truman, on his right, Bess and Margaret Truman descend a flight of stairs to join him.  (See 2002-463 through 469.) (Original negative included.)  From: Bayard C. Rucker.

title: Former President Truman aboard the S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center), Bess Truman (on his right, in white hat), and Margaret Truman (behind waiter on Bess's right), have lunch aboard the S.S. President Cleveland upon arrival at San Francisco, California, after a month's vacation in Hawaii.  The other people are unidentified.  From: Bayard C. Rucker.

title: Margaret Truman aboard the S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) poses with Captain Hobart J. Ehman aboard the S.S. President Cleveland upon arrival in San Francisco California, after a month's vacation in Hawaii with her father and mother.  (See 2002-463 through 469.)  (Original negative included.)  From: Bayard C. Rucker.

title: Former President Truman with members of the Racine (Wisconsin) Adult Education Council
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman meets with Coordinators of the Test Cities with the Fund for Adult Education, Racine Adult Education Council Incorporated, at his office in the Federal Reserve Bank Building, Kansas City, Missouri.  On his right is his brother, J. Vivian Truman.  The others are unidentified.  From:  James L. Page, Racine Adult Education Council Incorporated 620 Lake Avenue, Racine, Wisconsin

title: Trumans and others at a Theta Sigma Phi dinner
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and wife Bess pose for a photo with four members of Theta Sigma Phi on the occasion of a Matrix Dinner held at the Muehlebach Hotel, Kansas City, Missouri.  Left to right are:  Mr. Truman, Mrs. W.L.C. Palmer, Mrs. Georgia Neese Clark (former U.S. Treasurer), Mrs. Gordon McKenzie, Mrs. Willie Snow Ethridge (speaker from Louisville, Kentucky), and Bess Truman.  From:  Mrs. W.L.C. Palmer

title: Truman and Jack Benny in a musical duet at the Truman Library
Scopenote: A smiling former President Harry S. Truman accompanies violin virtuoso Jack Benny on the piano at the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, during preparations for a TV program.  (Similar to 60-28)  From:  Kim Park.

title: Former President Truman plays piano in the Little White House
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, during a trip to Duck Key, Florida, with his family, visits the Little White House at Key West and plays the piano which had formerly been on the U.S.S. Williamsburg.  Looking on is Rear Admiral Louis J. Kirn.  From:  Mrs. Alva Parks.

title: Truman and others at the Idlewild Airport, New York City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands on the speakers' platform during opening ceremonies at the dedication of the Idlewild Airport, New York City.  On speakers platform, from left to right are: unidentified, General Omar Bradley, press secretary Charles Ross, General Robert Landry, President Truman, New York City Mayor William O'Dwyer, Grover A. Whalen, Chairman of the Mayor's Committee for the Commemoration of the Golden Anniversary of the City of New York, unidentified, unidentified, and Governor of New York and Republican candidate for President Thomas E. Dewey.  The others are unidentified.  From:  Bill Sitler, Tulsa, Oklahoma.

title: Truman and John M. Patterson at Crusade for Freedom office
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with John M. Patterson at the office of the Crusade for Freedom, Radio Free Europe Fund.  The exact date and location are unknown.

title: Truman with members of Industrial College of the Armed Forces at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman in an eight-way handshake with members of the "Blue Team" from the Industrial College of the Armed Forces, Fort Lesley J. McNair, Washington, D.C., who were at the Truman Library for a National Security Seminar.  Left to right are:  Unidentified, Colonel John A. Riffle, Colonel Fred J. Frazer, Colonel William A. Twitchell, Former President Truman, Colonel Charles E. Caple, Lt. Colonel Walter G. Allen, and Colonel Robert E. Goerder.  (See 2004-396 thru 401; 77-2523 thru 2529; 77-2571 and 2572; 72-3753; and 2006-132 thru 134.)  From:  Lucille Patterson

title: Truman with members of the Industrial College of the Armed Forces at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits at his desk in his office at the Truman Library and speaks with members of the "Blue Team" from the Industrial College of the Armed Forces, Fort Lesley J. McNair, Washington, D.C., and others who were there for a National Security Seminar.  Of those who can be identified are Colonel John A. Riffle (left-standing) and Col. Fred J. Frazer (seated 3rd from left).  (See 2004-396 thru 401; 77-2523 thru 2529; 77-2571 and 2572; 72-3753; and 2006-131, 133 and 134.)  From:  Lucille Patterson.
Institutional Creator: Farnan Foto Service, Kansas City, MO

title: Truman with members of Industrial College of the Armed Forces at Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (third from left) is shown in a six-way handshake with three members of the "Blue Team," Industrial College of the Armed Forces, Fort Lesley J. McNair, Washington, D.C., and others who visited the Truman Library during a National Security Seminar in Kansas City, Missouri. Of those who can be identified are Colonel Fred J. Frazer (3rd from right), Colonel John A. Riffle (2nd from right), and Rufus Burrus (right). (See 2004-396 thru 401; 77-2523 thru 2529; 77-2571 and 2572; 72-3753; and 2006-131, 132, and 134.) From: Lucille Patterson
Institutional Creator: Farnan Foto Service, Kansas City, MO

title: Truman and members of Industrial College of the Armed Forces at Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits at his desk in his office at the Truman Library and visits with members of the "Blue Team" from the Industrial College of the Armed Forces, Fort Lesley J. McNair, Washington, D.C., and others who were in Kansas City for a National Security Seminar.  The only person identified is Colonel John A. Riffle (standing).  See 2004-396 thru 401; 77-2523 thru 2529; 77-2571 and 2572; 72-3753; and 2006-131, 132 and 133.)  From:  Lucille Patterson.
Institutional Creator: Farnan Foto Service, Kansas City, MO

title: John F. Kennedy, Curtis LeMay, and an unidentified officer at an airport
Scopenote: John F. Kennedy (left), General Curtis LeMay (center), and an unidentified officer stand under the wing of a plane.  The date and location are unknown.  From:  Lucille Patterson.

title: Former President Truman in his car at his home
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman waves to an Independence Examiner photographer from the driver's seat of his automobile at the intersection of an alley and Delaware St. near his home at 219 N. Delaware, Independence, Missouri.  From:  Herb Pardee, Sports Editor, The Independence Examiner, Independence, Missouri

title: Senator Harry S. Truman aboard the U.S.S. Dubuque
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman enjoys a Naval Reserve cruise on the Great Lakes on board the U.S.S. Dubuque, a World War I gunboat used for training.  From:  George Peck.

title: Senator Truman and Lt. Commander Lowenstein aboard U.S.S. Dubuque
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) stands next to Lieutenant Commander Henry P. Lowenstein aboard the U.S.S. Dubuque, a World War I gunboat used for training on the Great Lakes.  From:  George L. Peck.

title: The U.S.S. Dubuque, a World War I gunboat
Scopenote: The crew of the U.S.S. Dubuque, a World War I gunboat used for training on the Great Lakes, lines the railing and waves to the crowds while in port.  (See 2006-137 and 138.)  From:  George L. Peck.

title: Truman peers into a 75mm field gun at New York's Idlewild Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stoops and peers into one of the Battery of 75mm guns which had saluted him on his arrival for the dedication of Idlewild International Airport, New York City. He is looking into a 75mm field gun mounted on a M2A3 high speed carriage.  From:  Bill Sitler, Tulsa, Oklahoma.

title: Former President Truman and unidentified foreign visitors at Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) welcomes a group of unidentified foreign students to his office at the Truman Library.  From:  Manouchehr Pedran, Ph.D, President, Global and Multicultural Education Center

title: Trumans and Jim Kelly in Broken Bow, Nebraska
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (center), standing next to President Harry S. Truman (left), waves to the crowd from the rear platform of a train during a 1948 campaign Whistlestop in Broken Bow, Nebraska.  On her left is a local resident, Jim Kelly.  From:  Mrs. Ed Pelanowski.

title: Replica of the Drury Lane Theater production "Autumn Crocus"
Scopenote: Miniature doll replica of a production of "Autumn Crocus" starring Margaret Truman, including stage and audience, at the Drury Lane Theater, Chicago, Illinois, a south-side summer theater.  Dolls in the front row of the audience are identified as Harry, Bess, and Clifton.  From:  Peter M. Plotke, The Journal, Wulfing Publications, Lake at William St., Lansing, Illinois

title: Former President Truman shakes hands with Steve W. Pilson, Sr.
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from left) shakes hands with Steve W. Pilson, Sr., who is behind a rope barrier. Margaret Truman is on the right. The event, date, and location are unknown. The others in the photo are unidentified. The mat of the picture is autographed as follows: 1948 to 1957 - To a good President. To a real American. With best wishes always. To Harry S. Truman and his lovely family. Steve W. Pilson, Sr.

title: Truman and a Secret Service agent in Pottsville, Pennsylvania
Scopenote: On a Whistlestop tour in his campaign for the election of Gov. Adlai Stevenson to the presidency, President Harry S. Truman (left) arrives in Pottsville, Pennsylvania, to speak at the local high school.  The Secret Service agent accompanying him is unidentified.  The photo is signed by "Harry S. Truman."  (See 93-50-2.)

title: Former President Truman visits with Cabell Phillips
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (back to camera) sits at his desk in his office at the Truman Library and visits with Cabell Phillips of the New York Times. The photograph is autographed as follows: "With great respect to my favorite President, Cabell Phillips, N.Y. Times - 5-5-59." From: Cobert Phillips

title: Truman visit to the U.S. Coast Guard Academy, New London, Connecticut
Scopenote: On his first visit to the U.S. Coast Guard Academy at New London, Connecticut, President Harry S. Truman watches two cadets present arms as he walks among an honor guard of cadets standing at attention.  (See 70-4816 thru 70-4834.)  (Same as 70-4823 except not cropped)  From:  Captain O.A. Peterson, U.S.C.G.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Cadets reviewed by President Truman
Scopenote: Cadets at the U.S. Coast Guard Academy, New London, Connecticut, pass in review before President Harry S. Truman (not shown) during the President's first visit to the Academy.  (See 70-4816 thru 70-4834).    From:  Captain O.A. Peterson, U.S.C.G.

title: Truman at the helm of the Coast Guard Academy bark "Eagle"
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman feigns steering the  U.S. Coast Guard Academy bark, the "Eagle," as he stands at the helm during his first visit to the Academy in New London, Connecticut.  Captain Carl G. Bowman, U.S.C.G., skipper of the "Eagle" is in the background.  (See 70-4816 thru 70-4834.  See also 68-1564.)  From:  Captain O.A. Peterson, U.S.C.G.

title: Truman speaks to General Eisenhower from back seat of car at Potsdam
Scopenote: In Germany for the Potsdam conference, President Harry S. Truman, reading a newspaper in the back seat of an automobile, speaks to General Dwight D. Eisenhower standing by the open back door.  From:  Francis D. Peterson

title: Margaret Truman receives a porcelain model of the Freedom Bell
Scopenote: During her European tour, Margaret Truman visited Berlin, Germany, where she was received by Mayor Dr. Walther Schreiber and the Protocol Chief, Dr. Busse, at the Schoeneberg Townhall.  Dr. Schreiber handed her a porcelain model of the Freedom Bell.  She also signed the Golden Guestbook of the city Berlin.  Left to right are:  Professor Eich, Dr. Busse, Miss Truman, and Dr. Schreiber.  (See 78-371.)  From:  Willard B. Snyder, Honorarkonsul der Bundesrepublik Deutschland.

title: Truman and General Services Administration representatives at Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (third from left) poses with representatives of the General Services Administration at the North entrance of the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.  Laphene Peterson is a member of the party, although he is not identified.  The others are unidentified.  From:  Laphene Peterson.

title: Truman casts ballot in Missouri's Democratic primary election
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman grins for the reporters as he casts his ballot in Missouri's Democratic primary election in Independence, Missouri's Memorial Building.  On his right is his brother-in-law, George Wallace, a Democratic Judge at the seventh precinct, first ward.  Seated is Republican Judge Ray Pryor.  (See 70-1129 and 69-413.)  (Original 35 mm. negative included)  From:  Robert Pennell.

title: Truman casts ballot in Missouri's Democratic primary election
Scopenote: As his daughter, Margaret, looks on, President Harry S. Truman casts his ballot in Missouri's Democratic Primary election held in Independence, Missouri's Memorial Building.  On his right is his brother-in-law, George Wallace, a Democratic Judge at the Seventh Precinct, First Ward.  Seated is Republican Judge Ray Pryor.  (See 70-1129 and 69-413.)  (Original 35 mm. negative included)  From:  Robert Pennell.

title: Margaret Truman casts ballot in Missouri's Democratic primary election
Scopenote: As her father, President Harry S. Truman, looks on, Margaret Truman, casts her ballot in Missouri's Democratic Primary election held in Independence, Missouri's Memorial Building. On Mr. Truman's right is George Wallace, a Democratic Judge at the Seventh Precinct, First Ward. Seated is Republican Judge Ray Pryor. (See 70-1129 and 69-413.) (Original 35 mm. negative included) From: Robert Pennell.

title: Margaret Truman casts ballot in Missouri's Democratic primary election
Scopenote: As her father, President Harry S. Truman (partly obscured), looks on, Margaret Truman casts her ballot in Missouri's Democratic Primary election held in Independence, Missouri's Memorial Building.  On the left, in front of President Truman, is George Wallace, a Democratic Judge at the Seventh Precinct, First Ward.  Seated is Republican Judge Ray Pryor.  (See 70-1129 and 69-413.)  (Original 35 mm. negative included)  From:  Robert Pennell.

title: Trumans on the rear platform of a train at Sacramento, California
Scopenote: From left to right, Harold T. Johnson, Mayor of Roseville, California, President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman on the rear platform of a train leaving for San Francisco after making a  Whistlestop at Sacramento, California.    From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Train carrying President Truman leaves Sacramento, California after making a whistlestop
Scopenote: As the train carrying President Harry S. Truman leaves Sacramento, California, after making a Whistlestop, a very indistinct figure of the President waves to the crowd from the rear platform.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Rear platform of Truman's train at a whistlestop in Sacramento, California
Scopenote: The rear platform of the train carrying President Harry S. Truman on a Whistlestop tour is shown empty, at a stop in Sacramento, California, waiting for the President to emerge from the train to speak to the crowd gathered to greet him.  The Secret Service agent is unidentified.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Truman greets crowd at whistlestop in Roseville, California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left on platform) greets the crowd gathered to hear him speak from the rear platform of a train at a whistlestop in Roseville, California.  The others on the platform are unidentified.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Crowd gathered to greet President Truman at Roseville, California
Scopenote: A crowd, hands raised in greeting, surrounds the rear platform of the train carrying President Harry S. Truman on a whistlestop campaign tour as it makes a stop in Roseville, California.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Margaret Truman visits the Berlin Airlift Memorial in West Germany
Scopenote: Margaret Truman, daughter of President Harry S. Truman, visits the memorial to the Berlin Airlift in Berlin, West Germany, during her European tour.  On her right is General Mathewson.  The others are unidentified.  From:  Willard B. Snyder, Honorarkonsul der Bundesrepublik Deutschland.

title: Truman makes a Whistlestop in Roseville, California
Scopenote: A crowd, hands raised in greeting, surrounds the rear platform of the train carrying President Harry S. Truman on a campaign tour as it makes a whistlestop in Roseville, California.  The President, his wife and daughter are also on the rear platform but not seen distinctly.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Truman on the rear platform of a train in Sacramento, California
Scopenote: From the rear platform of a train, President Harry S. Truman surveys the crowd gathered to greet him at a whistlestop in Sacramento, California. The other man on the train is unidentified. From: Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Truman making a whistlestop in Sacramento, California
Scopenote: From the rear platform of a train, President Harry S. Truman (second from the left) smiles at the crowd gathered to greet him at a whistlestop in Sacramento, California during a campaign tour.  On the left is Harold T. Johnson, mayor of Roseville, California.  The other men are unidentified.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Truman on rear platform of train at whistlestop in Sacramento, California
Scopenote: From the rear platform of a train, President Harry S. Truman (second from the left) surveys the crowd gathered to meet him at a whistlestop in Sacramento, California, during a campaign tour.  Harold T. Johnson, Mayor of Roseville, California, is on Truman's right.  The other men are unidentified.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County, Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Truman on rear platform of train in Sacramento, California
Scopenote: From the rear platform of a train, President Harry S. Truman (second from the left) looks down at the crowd gathered to greet him at a Whistlestop in Sacramento, California, during a campaign tour.  The man on the left is Harold T. Johnson, Mayor of Roseville, California.  The other man is unidentified.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County, Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Truman on rear platform of train in Sacramento, California
Scopenote: From the rear platform of a train during a campaign tour, President Harry S. Truman (third from left) greets the crowd gathered to meet him at a Whistlestop in Sacramento, California.  The others on the platform are unidentified.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: View of crowd gathered to meet Truman in Sacramento, California
Scopenote: At a whistlestop in Sacramento, California, a crowd gathers around the rear platform of the train carrying President Harry S. Truman on a campaign tour.  People can be seen climbing the steps to walk by the President and shake his hand.  From:  Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: Truman on rear platform of train in Sacramento, California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman on the rear platform of a train greeting the crowd gathered to meet him at a Whistlestop in Sacramento, California, during a 1948 campaign tour. Others on the platform are unidentified. From: Carol Paoli, Plumas County Museum, 500 Jackson St., Quincy, CA 95971

title: The Church of St. Mary Aldermanbury and Churchill Memorial, Westminster College, Fulton, Missouri

Scopenote: Pennsylvania Democrats attend a conference sponsored by Robert E. Hannegan, Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, at the Biltmore Hotel in Philadelphia, prior to the 28th Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Scopenote: Photo of United States map of President Harry S. Truman's 1948 Whistle Stop Tour, with ribbons and pins marking the route and stops on the tour.

title: Truman in an automobile at Shasta College, Redding, California
Scopenote: From the back seat of a convertible, President Harry S. Truman, hat in hand, waves to the crowd gathered to greet him on the football field at Shasta College, Redding, California.  President Truman was on a Western trip at that time campaigning for Adlai Stevenson.  Donor:  Stella Dillenbeck.

title: French President Auriol, Truman and others look at a photo album
Scopenote: Visiting the White House, President Vincent Auriol of France receives a gift from President Harry S. Truman, a handsome leather-bound volume of color photographs depicting scenes of America.  In the Oval Office are (left to right):  President Truman and President Auriol (sitting); and (standing) Secretary of State Dean Acheson, French Minister of Foreign Affairs Robert Schuman, French Ambassador Henri Bonnet, Special Assistant to the President W. Averill Harriman, and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman.  (Similar to 77-1600; also see 2006-178.)

title: French President Auriol, President Truman and others look at a photo album
Scopenote: Visiting the White House, President Vincent Auriol of France receives a gift from President Harry S. Truman, a leather-bound volume of color photographs depicting scenes of America. Averill Harriman, French Minister of Foreign Affairs Robert Schuman, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, and two unidentified men.  (See 77-1600 and 2006-177.)

title: President Harry S. Truman and Winston Churchill in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Winston Churchill, Prime Minister of Great Britain, sit down in the Oval Office to begin their formal White House conferences.  (See 68-1520 and 67-7589.)

title: Labor leaders of the Pittsburgh Steel Company hold a rally in Monessen, Pa
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (not shown) sits on the speaker's platform while a labor leader from the Pittsburgh Steel Co. speaks to a crowd gathered in Monessen, Pa., for a Democratic rally supporting the Stevenson/Kefauver ticket.  From:  John B. Sucevic, Safety Inspector, Pittsburgh Steel Company.

title: Truman, Oscar Chapman, and C. Girard Davidson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with Oscar Chapman, Secretary of the Interior (right), and C. Girard Davidson (center), Assistant Secretary, in the Oval Office at the White House.  The photo is autographed by Oscar Chapman as follows:  With kind regards, 12/21/50.  (Same as 73-3485-A except for autograph)

title: Dedication of the Four Statues, gifts of Italy, at Memorial Bridge in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (left), an unidentified man and others, gather for the dedication of the Four Equestrian Statues, gifts of the people of Italy to the United States, sit in chairs awaiting President Harry S. Truman's speech.  The statues are at the entrance to the Memorial Bridge that crosses the Potomac River.  The man seated behind Secretary Chapman may be Dale Doty, Assistant Secretary of the Interior.  (See 65-2830 thru 2847.)

title: Margaret Truman and others in Nashville, Tennessee, at Ryman Auditorium
Scopenote: Margaret Truman poses with friends during a concert engagement at the Ryman Auditorium in Nashville, Tennessee.  Only Silliman Evans Sr., (2nd from left (standing) and Lucille Evans (Mrs. Silliman Evans, Sr.), right (sitting) can be identified.  (See 2001-1 and 2.)  From:  Harry Draper.

title: Truman in the Sherman Hotel, Chicago, Illinois
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (front row, second from left), in Chicago for the Democratic National Convention, walking down the hallway of the Sherman Hotel in Chicago, Illinois, where he is to deliver the keynote address at the Fraternal Order of Eagles four-day international convention.  Others in the photo are unidentified.    From:  Mrs. Enslow C. Douglas.

title: Truman rides in car with Walter Meneffee at Henry County Fair
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (waving hat), flanked by an unidentified motorcycle escort, waves from the rear seat of a Cadillac convertible in Clinton, Missouri where he will attend the opening of the Henry County Fair. Seated next to him is Clinton Postmaster Walter Meneffee, Truman's sergeant in Battery D, 35th Division during World War I. The driver is Cleo Woody of Woody Motor Company. The front passenger is Asher Williams, president of the Clinton Chamber of Commerce. From: Elvin Durr.

title: Truman signs Document Authorizing Participation in Haiti Bicentennial International Exposition
Scopenote: In the Oval Office at the White House, President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs the document authorizing the participation of the United States in the International Exposition for the Bicentennial of the founding of Port-au-Prince, Haiti.  Standing from left to right are:  Rene Colimon, 1st Secretary of the Haitian Embassy in Washington, D.C.; Jules Domond, Commercial Attache at the Haitian Embassy; and Melvin Hildreth, President of the Democratic Party of Washington, D.C.  From:  Pierre Edouard Domond, Courtesy of the Chantal Domond Prints and Photographs Collection

title: Truman and Homer Thornberry in Georgetown, Texas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), on the campaign trail, speaks from the rear platform of a train at a whistlestop in Georgetown, Texas.  On the right is Homer Thornberry, Democratic candidate for the House of Representatives.  (See 74-836.)  From:  Billy Coe Dyer.

title: Portrait of James Pendergast
Scopenote: Portrait of James Pendergast, Kansas City political faction leader, long-time friend of former President Harry S. Truman  From:  Michael Pruett

title: Truman on the reviewing stand at Eglin Air Force Base, Florida
Scopenote: During a visit to Eglin Air Force Base, Florida, President Harry S. Truman (seated, third from left) speaks with Maj. General W.E. Kepner (seated, fourth from left), Commanding General of the Base, as they and unidentified others sit on a reviewing stand watching a military air show.  From:  Mrs. J.E. Dziadosz.

title: Truman and C.H. Nowlin at the Federal Reserve Bank Building
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) receives a plaque from the Writer's Guild, presented by C.H. Nowlin at Mr. Truman's office in the Federal Reserve Bank Building, Kansas City, Missouri.  From:  C.H. Nowlin.

title: Former President Truman at a Democratic rally in Monessen, Pennsylvania
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (seated, second from right) sits on the speakers' platform with labor leaders from the Pittsburgh Steel Company, awaiting his turn to address the crowd gathered in Monessen, Pa., for a Democratic rally supporting the Stevenson/Kefauver ticket.  None of the others is identified.  From:  John B. Sucevic, Safety Inspector, Pittsburgh Steel Company.

title: Trumans in an automobile at Fairfax Airport, Kansas
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, his daughter Margaret and brother J. Vivian ride in the back seat of an automobile as they depart from Fairfax Airport, Kansas City, Kansas.  (See 77-140.)  From:  Jerry Norberg.

title: Former President Truman and two cadets at Wentworth Military Academy
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) speaks with two cadets during Founder's Day ceremonies at Wentworth Military Academy, Lexington, Missouri.  Mr. Truman spoke at a luncheon and later laid wreaths on the graves of the Founder, Stephen G. Wentworth, and Colonel S. Sellers, Sr., Superintendent for more than 50 years.  The cadet on the right is Dorrel L. Nofsinger, and the cadet on the left is (first name unknown) Crosby.  (See also 2003-110, 111 and 112.)  From:  Dorrel L. Nofsinger.

title: Former President Truman with two unidentified men in Salzburg, Austria
Scopenote: During his European tour, former President Harry S. Truman (center), clasps hands with two unidentified men in Salzburg, Austria, outside a building, most probably the U.S. Embassy.  The photo bears a copy of Mr. Truman's signature.  The back is signed by Isaak Neuwirth, Senior Partner of the company L. Ornstein, Salzburg, Manufacturers of Loden apparel.  From:  Isaak Neuwirth.

title: Former President Truman with three unidentified men in Salzburg, Austria
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from left) with three unidentified men inside a building in Salzburg, Austria.  The photo bears a copy of Mr. Truman's signature.  The back is autographed by Isaak Neuwirth, Senior Partner of the company L. Ornstein, Salzburg, manufacturers of Loden apparel.  From:  Isaak Neuwirth.

title: Former President Truman at the opening of a new freeway in Kansas City, Missouri
Scopenote: Behind the logo of the Chamber of Commerce and with the Power & Light building in the background, former President Harry S. Truman speaks at the opening of the southeast freeway in Kansas City, Missouri.  The other dignitaries on the speakers' platform are unidentified.  From:  Dr. D.M. Nigro.

title: Truman at the opening of a new freeway in Kansas City, Missouri
Scopenote: Behind the logo of the Chamber of Commerce, former President Harry S. Truman speaks at the opening of the southeast freeway in Kansas City, Missouri.  The other dignitaries on the speakers' platform are unidentified.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro.

Scopenote: Honorary member, former President Harry S. Truman, (second from left) watches two people at the podium during a U.S. Navy Fleet Reserve Association dinner at the Bellerive Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri. The other men are unidentified.   From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro.

title: Former President Truman at Fleet Reserve Association dinner
Scopenote: Honorary member, former President Harry S. Truman (center), sits at the dinner table at a meeting of the U.S. Navy Fleet Reserve Association, at the Bellerive Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri. The other men are unidentified. From: Dr. D. M. Nigro.

title: Former President Truman at a Fleet Reserve Association dinner
Scopenote: During a dinner meeting of the U.S. Navy Fleet Reserve Association at the Bellerive Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman (left) chats with an unidentified clergyman.  Mr. Truman is an honorary member of the Association.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro

title: Former President Truman at a Fleet Reserve Association dinner
Scopenote: During a dinner meeting of the U.S. Navy Fleet Reserve Association at the Bellerive Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman (left) chats with an unidentified man.  Mr. Truman is an honorary member of the Association.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro

title: Former President Truman with Adlai Stevenson and others at Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, wearing a big "Yes for the Charter" button, shows visitors around the Truman Library. (Similar to 59-401-1)  From:  Adlai Stevenson

title: Former President Truman shakes hands with a labor leader from the Pittsburgh Steel Company
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (third from left), seated on the speaker's platform, shakes hands with a Democratic supporter from the Pittsburgh Steel Company at a rally supporting the Stevenson/Kefauver ticket, held in Monessen, Pennsylvania. title: Truman at a Fleet Reserve Association dinner
Scopenote: During a dinner meeting of the U.S. Navy Fleet Reserve Association at the Bellerive Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman (center) chats with two unidentified men.  Mr. Truman is an honorary member of the Association.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro.

title: Former President Truman at an unidentified event
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, in light suit, poses with a group of unidentified men in front of a life-size mural of what seems to be the audience at a sporting event.  The date, location, and event are unknown.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro.

Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) stands behind a chair listening to the unidentified speaker on his left at a luncheon sponsored by the United Nations Organization "We Believe."  The location is unknown.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro.

Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman (left and second from left) sit down to a luncheon with unidentified others.  The location, event, and date are unknown.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro.

Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) speaks with two unidentified men.  The occasion is a luncheon, but the event, location, and date are unknown.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro.

Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) at the luncheon table with three unidentified others.  The location, event, and date are unknown.  From:  Dr. D. M. Nigro.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks from the steps of a building to a bi-racial audience.  On his left are five Negro military men.  The event, location, and date are unknown, though possibly in Kansas City.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is escorted off the Independence by Vice Admiral Arthur W. Radford after landing at Hickam Field, Pearl Harbor, Hawaii.  The President is on his way to Wake Island for a meeting with General MacArthur.  From:  Earl and B.J. Greathouse

title: President Truman Shakes Hands with General MacArthur at Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with General Douglas MacArthur as he leaves the air field on Wake Island for a historic meeting on Korea and world peace--the first time the two met face to face.   (See also 69-1199-A&B, 69-358, 68-1058, and 67-1434.)  From:  Earl & B.J. Greathouse.

title: The building on Wake Island which housed the conference between President Harry S. Truman and General MacArthur
Scopenote: The building, the home of the Pan American Airways station manager on Wake Island, was the scene of the historic conference between President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur.  (See also 64-366.)  From:  Earl & B.J. Greathouse

title: An unidentified officer in the doorway of the building used by President Harry S. Truman on Wake Island
Scopenote: An unidentified officer stands in the doorway of the building (the home of the Pan American Airways station manager on Wake Island) selected for the historic face-to-face meeting between President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur to discuss Korea and world peace.  From:  Earl & B.J. Greathouse, 4308 Piikea Place, Honolulu, HI 96818

title: Entrance to war-time cave on Wake Island
Scopenote: The entrance to a cave used in war time as a photo lab for press attending the historic meeting between President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur on Wake Island.  From:  Earl and B.J. Greathouse

title: Cave on Wake Island used by the press during Truman-MacArthur meeting
Scopenote: The interior (kitchen facilities) of a cave used as a photo lab by the press attending the historic meeting between President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur on Wake Island.  From:  Earl and B.J. Greathouse.

Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Others on the platform, unidentified, are labor leaders from the Pittsburgh Steel Company.  From:  John B. Sucevic, Safety Inspector, Pittsburgh Steel Company

title: Autographed portrait of former President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman
Scopenote: Portrait of former President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman standing before a train, with the matte autographed to Mrs. George Docking, wife of the Governor of Kansas, as follows:  To the Honorable Mrs. Docking, with kindest regards to a great Governor and a Kansas First Lady, May 18, 1962, Harry S. Truman.  From:  John Elias Nasser

title: Autographed photo of Senator Harry S. Truman and his mother, Martha Ellen Truman
Scopenote: Photo of Harry S. Truman and his mother, Martha Ellen Truman, made just after his election to the United States Senate.  The photo is autographed "Harry S. Truman."  From:  Alexander F. Nahas

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman doffs his hat to the crowd as he sits in the rear of a convertible in a motorcade on the way to Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, California, for Flag Day ceremonies where he will give a speech.  From:  National Archives & Records Administration

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess and Margaret Truman at the Boca Chica airport in Florida
Scopenote: Left to right:  Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and President Harry S. Truman are greeted by Captain Cecil Adell as they step off the plane at the Boca Chica airport in Florida, where the President and family will continue on to Key West.  (Same as 66-944 except not cropped)  From:  National Archives & Records Administration

title: President Harry S. Truman holds a press conference on the U.S.S. Williamsburg, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds an informal press conference on the deck of the U.S.S. Williamsburg at Key West, Florida.  Those who can be identified are Charles Ross (second from left, standing) and Captain Cecil Adell (fourth from right, standing).    From:  National Archives & Records Administration

title: President Harry S. Truman before a fireplace on the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses before a fireplace on the U.S.S. Williamsburg during a nine-day cruise off the northeast coast of the United States (similar to 66-1106).  From:  National Archives & Records Administration

Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders painting of Georgia Neese Clark Gray, who was the first woman Treasurer of the United States, and served from 1949 to 1953.  The portrait was painted by David Zlotky for the Harry S. Truman Library.  From:  Harry S. Truman Library Institute

title: President Harry S. Truman awards the Medal for Merit to David K. Niles
Scopenote: In a ceremony on the lawn of the White House, President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with his Administrative Assistant, David K. Niles, and inspects the Medal for Merit which he has just awarded to Mr. Niles.  From:  David K. Niles

title: President Harry S. Truman presents the Medal of Merit to David K. Niles
Scopenote: In a ceremony on the White House lawn, President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with his Administrative Assistant, David K. Niles, and inspects the Medal of Merit which he has just awarded to Mr. Niles.  From:  David K. Niles.

title: President Harry S. Truman awards the Medal of Merit to David K. Niles
Scopenote: In a ceremony on the White House lawn, President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with his Administrative Assistant, David K. Niles, and inspects the Medal of Merit which he has just awarded him.  From:  David K. Niles

Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman doffs his hat to the photographer as he stands next to Bess Truman and Carl Cono in front of a new 1971 Chrysler.  Mr. Cono of Roberts Chrysler-Plymouth, Liberty, Missouri, has sold the former President a new car every year.  From:  Rose Ann Cono

title: Former President Truman and Kate Conniff on Coconut Island, Hawaii
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. title: Margaret Truman with Kate Conniff, Coconut Island, Hawaii
Scopenote: Margaret Truman kneels next to baby Kate Conniff, daughter of Mary Van Sant and George Winfield Conniff, during a stay on Coconut Island, Kaneohe Bay, Windward Oahu, Hawaii, where she, her mother and her father spent a vacation as the guests of Ed Pauley.  Former President Truman looks on.  From:  Mary Van Sant Conniff.

Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman turns around to speak to others seated on a platform during groundbreaking ceremonies for the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri. title: Former President Harry S. Truman greets Army personnel at Camp Ripley, Minnesota
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman was greeted by Army personnel as he arrived at Camp Ripley, Minnesota, to visit his old World War I unit, the 35th National Guard Division from Missouri and Kansas, in summer training.  The soldiers in the photo are unidentified.  Donor:  William H. Conway, Jr., Kansas City, MO.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman carrying the flag at Camp Ripley, Minnesota
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, at Camp Ripley, Minnesota, visiting his old World War I unit, the 35th National Guard Division from Missouri and Kansas, in summer training. title: Former President Harry S. Truman and others at Truman Library groundbreaking
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, his wife Bess and daughter Margaret turn around to speak to others seated on a platform during groundbreaking ceremonies for the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri. title: Former President Harry S. Truman speaks at the National Press Club, Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands behind the podium and speaks to the National Press Club in Washington, D.C., at a dinner marking the 13th anniversary of his 1948 election victory. From: John P. Cosgrove.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, John P. Cosgrove, and Ambassador Mohammed Mawandahl at the National Press Club Library, Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right)greets Mohammed Mawandahl, Ambassador to Afghanistan. title: Former President Harry S. Truman and John P. Cosgrove at the National Press Club Library, Washington, D.C.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and John P. Cosgrove at the National Press Club Library, Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman points to a book held by John P. Cosgrove, President of the National Press Club, at a reception given in Mr. Truman's honor at the National Press Club Library, Washington, D.C., which was attended by many members of his former Cabinet and "Little Cabinet." From:  John P. Cosgrove.

Top right:  "The presidency is a killing job.  It's killed more than one man.  I could name half a dozen".  Bottom left:  "It needs a young and vigorous man.  I've put in 40 years in public office.  I'm just a retired has-been".  Bottom right:  If the convention were deadlocked and he was drafted, Mr. Truman said:  "I would quote General Sherman "If nominated I will not accept; if elected I will not serve".
